intro: Oxyanthera papuana, commonly known as the Papuan oxyanthera, is a flowering plant native to Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Oxyanthera papuana is primarily found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
